oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MONITORING DAMAGE EVOLUTION OF CONSTRUCTED RUBBLE MOUND STRUCTURES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tsaimou, Christina
Chondros, Michalis
Tsoukala, Vasiliki
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Port and coastal rubble mound structures are constru- cted to minimize the effects of wave action on beaches and harbors. Their structural degradation and, conse- quently, their damage are usually linked to the instability of the armor layer, expressed as rocking, unitsâ€™ displace- ments, blanket sliding, or settlement (Campos et al. 2020a). Within the context of retaining the functionality of in-service rubble mound structures, monitoring insta- bility issues allows for understanding damage evolution and optimizing repair actions to confront failures.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; structures.119
